intro: Gypsocallis nudiflora, commonly known as the naked-flower gypsocallis, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant has strap-like leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating to reduce water loss. It produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers that are borne on tall, slender stalks. Gypsocallis nudiflora is adapted to thrive in hot, dry environments and is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
